marytts.signalproc.analysis
Class LsfAnalyser

java.lang.Object
  marytts.signalproc.analysis.LsfAnalyser

public class LsfAnalyser
extends java.lang.Object

Demonstration program to accompany the subroutines described in the articles by J. Rothweiler, on computing the Line Spectral Frequencies. From http://mysite.verizon.net/vzenxj75/myown1/joe/lsf/a2lsp.c

Author:
Marc Schröder

Method Detail

lpc2lsfInHz

public static double[] lpc2lsfInHz(double[] oneMinusA,
                                   int samplingRate)
Convert filter coefficients to lsp coefficients.

Parameters:
oneMinusA - A(z) = a0 - sum { ai * z^-i } . a0 = 1.
type - which of the four methods for a2lsf conversion to perform
Returns:
the lsf coefficients in the range 0 to 0.5*samplingRate, as an array of doubles of length oneMinusA.length-1.

                                   int type)

lpc2lsf

public static double[] lpc2lsf(double[] oneMinusA,
                               int type)
Convert filter coefficients to lsp coefficients.

Parameters:
oneMinusA - A(z) = a0 - sum { ai * z^-i } . a0 = 1.
type - which of the four methods for a2lsf conversion to perform
Returns:
the lsf coefficients in the range 0 to 0.5, as an array of doubles of length oneMinusA.length-1.

main2

public static void main2(java.lang.String[] argv)

lsfInHz2lpc

public static double[] lsfInHz2lpc(double[] lsf,
                                   int samplingRate)
Convert LSF frequencies into LPC coefficients. The analysis filter may be reconstructed: A(z) = 1/2 [ P(z) + Q(z) ]

Parameters:
lsf - the array of lsf coefficients, in Hertz frequencies
samplingRate - the sampling rate of the underlying audio data
Returns:
an array of length lsf.length+1, containing the LPC coefficients as in A(z) = a0 - sum { ai * z^-i } . a0 = 1.

lsfInBark2lpc

public static double[] lsfInBark2lpc(double[] lsfsInBark,
                                     int samplingRate)

lsf2lpc

public static double[] lsf2lpc(double[] lsf)
Convert LSF frequencies into LPC coefficients. The analysis filter may be reconstructed: A(z) = 1/2 [ P(z) + Q(z) ]

Parameters:
lsf - the array of lsf coefficients, in the range 0 to 0.5
Returns:
an array of length lsf.length+1, containing the LPC coefficients as in A(z) = a0 - sum { ai * z^-i } . a0 = 1.
